description: Cours de six crédits s'échelonnant sur une période de deux sessions. L'envergure du projet de recherche exigé dans ce cours est deux fois plus grande que dans le cas de CSI 5900. Les cours CSI 6900, CSI 5900 ne peuvent être combinés pour l'obtention de crédits. Cours ouvert uniquement aux étudiants inscrits à la maîtrise sans thèse. Ce cours est équivalent à COMP 5903 à la Carleton University. / A two-session course. The project is twice the scope of projects in CSI 5900. Courses CSI 6900, CSI 5900 cannot be combined for units. Not to be taken in the thesis option. This course is equivalent to COMP 5903 at Carleton University.
snippet: Cours de six crédits s'échelonnant sur une période de deux sessions.

title: CSI 7131 Advanced Parallel and Systolic Algorithms
description: Continuation of CSI 5131 (COMP 5704). This course is equivalent to COMP 6100 at Carleton University.
snippet: Continuation of CSI 5131 (COMP 5704).

title: CSI 7160 Advanced Topics in the Theory of Computing
description: This course is equivalent to COMP 6601 at Carleton University.
snippet: This course is equivalent to COMP 6601 at Carleton University.

description: This course is equivalent to COMP 6603 at Carleton University.
snippet: This course is equivalent to COMP 6603 at Carleton University.

title: CSI 7162 Advanced Topics in Computer Applications
description: This course is equivalent to COMP 6604 at Carleton University.
snippet: This course is equivalent to COMP 6604 at Carleton University.

title: CSI 7163 Advanced Topics in Computer Systems
description: This course is equivalent to COMP 6605 at Carleton University.
snippet: This course is equivalent to COMP 6605 at Carleton University.

title: CSI 7170 Advanced Topics in Distributed Computing
description: This course is equivalent to COMP 6602 at Carleton University.
snippet: This course is equivalent to COMP 6602 at Carleton University.

title: CSI 7314 Advanced Topics in Object-Oriented Systems
description: Advanced object-oriented software engineering, in particular the issues of reuse and testing. Sample topics include: interaction modeling; class and cluster testing; traceability; design patterns and testing; the C++ standard template library. Students will carry out research. This course is equivalent to COMP 6104 at Carleton University.
snippet: Advanced object-oriented software engineering, in particular the issues of reuse and testing.

title: CSI 7561 Études avancées en systèmes et langages de programmation
description: Ce cours est équivalent à COMP 6603 à la Carleton University.
snippet: Ce cours est équivalent à COMP 6603 à la Carleton University.

title: CSI 7900 Projets de recherche en informatique / Graduate Projects in Computer Science
description: Ce cours est équivalent à COMP 6902 à la Carleton University. / This course is equivalent to COMP 6902 at Carleton University.
snippet: Ce cours est équivalent à COMP 6902 à la Carleton University.

title: CSI 7901 Études dirigées / Directed Studies
description: Ce cours est équivalent à COMP 6901 à la Carleton University. / This course is equivalent to COMP 6901 at Carleton University.
snippet: Ce cours est équivalent à COMP 6901 à la Carleton University.

title: CSI 9997 Proposition de thèse de doctorat / Doctoral Thesis Proposal
description: Within 8 terms following initial registration in the program, a document, generally defining the problem addressed, relating it to the literature, outlining the hypotheses, goals, research methodology, initial results and validation approach, must be submitted to an examination committee and successfully defended. Ce cours est équivalent à COMP 6908 à la Carleton University. This course is equivalent to COMP 6908 at Carleton University.
snippet: Within 8 terms following initial registration in the program, a document, generally defining the problem addressed, relating it to the literature, outlining the hypotheses, goals, research methodology, initial results and validation approach, must be submitted to an examination committee and successfully defended.

title: CSI 9998 Examen général de doctorat / Ph.D. Comprehensive
description: A committee must be assembled and must approve at least 3 topics for written examination: typically, a major and two minor areas. An oral examination occurs if the written exam is passed. Both elements must take place within the first 4 terms following initial registration in the program. The comprehensive examination may be failed, passed conditionally (i.e., with extra course requirements) or passed unconditionally. If failed, this course may be retaken at most one time. Ce cours est équivalent à COMP 6907 à la Carleton University. This course is equivalent to COMP 6907 at Carleton University.
snippet: A committee must be assembled and must approve at least 3 topics for written examination: typically, a major and two minor areas.
